intro: Lagenaria sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the calabash gourd, is a flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant produces large, spherical fruits that can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The fruit has a thick, hard rind and a sweet, edible pulp when mature. It is widely cultivated for its versatile uses in cooking, traditional medicine, and as a container.
